questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You manage a Dynamics 365 Sales environment for an organization.
You need to edit the display name of a business process flow.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

comments.content: Yes the above sequence is the correct one; Navigate to Processes > Select a BPF > Edit Process

discussion.content:
Navigate to Processes
Select a BPF
Edit process

On exam 27/4/22. Passed. I selected
Navigate to Processes
Select a business process flow
Edit the business process flow name

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A company uses Dynamics 365 Sales.
You create a playbook to send documents to new sales managers.
You need to configure the system to record all activity associated with each playbook.
Solution: Create a Power Automate flow to track the activities.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content: Starting July 7, 2023, the playbooks feature will be deprecated region-wise.
it doesnt. hence the answer is NO. enabling activity tracking will meet the requirement.
Why does it meet the requirements?

questions.answer_description:
Activity tracking is enabled in the Playbook template.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/sales-enterprise/track-playbook-activities

discussion.content: Starting July 7, 2023, the playbooks feature will be deprecated region-wise.

questions.answer_description:
Activity tracking is enabled in the Playbook template.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/sales-enterprise/track-playbook-activities
questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A company uses Dynamics 365 Sales.
You create a playbook to send documents to new sales managers.
You need to configure the system to record all activity associated with each playbook.
Solution: Enable auditing on for the Playbook Activity entity.
Does the solution meet the goal?

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A company uses Dynamics 365 Sales.
You create a playbook to send documents to new sales managers.
You need to configure the system to record all activity associated with each playbook.
Solution: Enable the playbook in Playbook settings.
Does the solution meet the goal?
questions.answer_description:
Activity tracking is enabled in the Playbook template.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/sales-enterprise/track-playbook-activities

discussion.content: Playbook will be deprecated in july 2023
NO is the answer. enabling activity tracking will do the trick , not auditing

All No, because on Track Progress set to Yes will work.

"If the playbook template used for the playbook has its Track progress field set to Yes, the activities are created under a playbook record that is under the calling record."

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A company uses Dynamics 365 Sales.
You create a playbook to send documents to new sales managers.
You need to configure the system to record all activity associated with each playbook.
Solution: Edit the playbook template and set the value of the Track Progress option to yes.
Does the solution meet the goal?
questions.answer_description:
Activity tracking is enabled in the Playbook template.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/sales-enterprise/track-playbook-activities
